Mr. Johnson's introduction into our local newspapers has been general coverage of mining activities in the area. We have heard much about the North West Adjustment Board, which has been established to provide a fair and impartial method of settling disputes between employers and employees. The board has been very successful in its first year of operation.

The situation today regarding the North West Adjustment Board is that it has organized the necessary for the adjustment of disputes between employers and employees. It has been very successful in its first year of operation.

The following question was raised at the meeting: "What is the difference between living as a tenant and owning property?" The answer given was that living as a tenant is more expensive than owning property because tenants do not own the property they live in.

SUBSTANTIATE CHARGES

The Editor: In a report in the recent issue of the Saskatchewan News, Mr. Jacobs, deputy minister of municipal affairs, said that he had received complaints from citizens regarding the North West Adjustment Board. He stated that these complaints were unfounded and that the board was doing a good job.

Mr. Jacobs, may I have the space to expand on the hardship faced by the poor farmer? The government has been criticized for not doing enough to help farmers who live on the land. They argue that the government should provide more assistance to farmers who live on the land.

There is a guarantee that the North West Adjustment Board will be elected next year. Last year our town council members were elected by a large margin. This year we expect a similar result.

In conclusion, the North West Adjustment Board has been very successful in its first year of operation. It has provided a fair and impartial method of settling disputes between employers and employees. We look forward to seeing what the board will accomplish in the future.

The Editor: In a report of the difference between living an honest life and doing something which is not honest, I have found myself in a situation where I must choose between two options: either to continue living an honest life or to engage in dishonest practices. After careful consideration, I have decided to continue living an honest life.

I am aware that some people may view my decision as naive or idealistic, but I believe that honesty is the best policy. I am confident that by living an honest life, I will be able to achieve my goals and make a positive impact on the world.

In conclusion, I urge everyone to consider the importance of honesty in their lives. By living an honest life, we can build trust and earn the respect of others.

Note to Persons Answering the Local Government Questionnaire:

This questionnaire is divided into four parts:

PART I: Statute Labour Districts and Local Improvement Districts
PART II: Rural Township Local Improvement Districts and Rural Municipalities after 1908.
PART III: Villages and Cities.
